Class Optics

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.physics.classical.waves.optics.Optics
public class Optics extends Object
Optics equations and models (geometric and wave optics). * @author Silvere Martin-Michiellot

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static Real
    diffractionAngle(Real gratingSpacing, int order, Real wavelength)
    Diffraction grating: d sin(θ) = mλ Returns diffraction angle for order m
    static Real
    lensMakerEquation(Real n, Real r1, Real r2)
    Lens Maker's Equation: 1/f = (n - 1) * (1/R1 - 1/R2) For a thin lens in air.
    static Real
    magnification(Real imageDistance, Real objectDistance)
    Magnification: M = -di/do = hi/ho
    static Real
    mirrorEquation(Real objectDistance, Real focalLength)
    Mirror equation: 1/f = 1/do + 1/di Same form as thin lens equation.
    static Quantity<Energy>
    photonEnergy(Quantity<Length> wavelength)
    Energy of photon: E = hf = hc/λ
    static Real
    rayleighCriterion(Real wavelength, Real apertureDiameter)
    Rayleigh criterion for resolution: θ_min = 1.22 λ/D
    static Real
    snellsLaw(Real n1, Real theta1, Real n2)
    Snell's law: n₁ sin(θ₁) = n₂ sin(θ₂) Returns refraction angle θ₂
    static Real
    thinLensImageDistance(Real objectDistance, Real focalLength)
    Thin lens equation: 1/f = 1/do + 1/di Returns image distance di given object distance do and focal length f

    • mirrorEquation

      public static Real mirrorEquation(Real objectDistance, Real focalLength)
      Mirror equation: 1/f = 1/do + 1/di Same form as thin lens equation. Returns image distance di given object distance do and focal length f.

    • lensMakerEquation

      public static Real lensMakerEquation(Real n, Real r1, Real r2)
      Lens Maker's Equation: 1/f = (n - 1) * (1/R1 - 1/R2) For a thin lens in air.
      Parameters:
      n - Refractive index of lens material
      r1 - Radius of curvature of first surface (positive if convex towards light)
      r2 - Radius of curvature of second surface (positive if convex towards light)
      Returns:
      Focal length f
